channel.title: Mendorphin's Random Sentence Generator Version 1.2 [Updated]
channel.description:
This is the first thing I've ever made from scratch using Java, it's a useless tool for anyone except me, as I am just using something simple to start off. I am using this to understand the aspects, the principles and the logic of how Java works.
In version 1.1, I just created a class and a compiler and read the information to display a random sentence generated from six strings into the run.bat.
In version 1.2, I have learnt a bit more. I learned how to package and how to create a loop to re-generate another random sentence, unlike version 1.1, where you had to keep opening the batch file for a new sentence everytime.
In version 2.0, I want to completely re-write it using extended classes and implements, calling each string individually and displaying all elements for the string called into a GUI.
Remember, this isn't "how can I develop my sentence generator", it's for me to try out new things and share them with you when they work. Take a look if you're interested. It's only 8.02KB unzipped. :P
Download link for version 1.2: http://www.mediafire.com/?tamd6i362z7qm5h
Note: always check .bat files for malicious content before executing. Mine of course has none, as will see when you download.
[URL=http://img33.imageshack.us/i/122ay.png/][IMG]http://img33.imageshack.us/img33/1215/122ay.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://img259.imageshack.us/i/121c.png/][IMG]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/2861/121c.png[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://img44.imageshack.us/i/123bk.png/][IMG]http://img44.imageshack.us/img44/5903/123bk.png[/img][/URL]

part_1 = ['That person ', 'Jamie ', 'Someone ', 'A moparscaper '] part_2 = ['wants to ', 'has to ', 'wishes to ', 'needs to '] part_3 = ['kill ', 'slay ', 'slice ', 'punch '] part_4 = ['his ', 'her '] part_5 = ['mother', 'father', 'brother', 'sister'] puts part_1[rand(4)] + part_2 [rand(4)] + part_3[rand(4)] + part_4[rand(2)] + part_5[rand(4)]

Perl and Python can do it in 6 as well.[/quote]

item.title: Mendorphin's Random Sentence Generator Version 1.2 [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

#!/usr/bin/perl @part1 = ("Mendorphins ", "Michael Jackson ", "Andrew Gower ", "Bill Gates ", "Stevie Wonder ", "50 Cent ", "Simon Cowell ", "Tinky-Winky ", "Jeremy Clarkson ", "Richard Hammond ", "James May ", "Tony Blair ", "George Bush ", "Sadam Hussein ", "Eric Cartman ", "Bin-Laden ", "My mother-in-law ", "Your crackhead grandma ", "The Asian community ", "This fat chick "); @part2 = ("has to ", "wants to ", "should not ", "got bribed by a black man to ", "thought they would ", "had an accident and therefore had to ", "more than likely wants to ", "probably should ", "can't exactly ", "hopes to God that their mum wants to "); @part3 = ("rape ", "have sex with ", "set on fire ", "pinch ", "murder ", "poo on ", "smile at ", "play with ", "finger ", "toss off ", "wank off ", "discombobulate ", "make babies with ", "make a baby with ", "smell ", "fart on ", "grate the end off of ", "tea-bag "); @part4 = ("your ", "their "); @part5 = ("smelly ", "sexy ", "stupid ", "butt-ugly ", "lovely ", "pretty ", "stinky ", "shit-stained ", "crab-invested ", "spunk-flavoured ", "fat ", "skinny ", "trampy ", "drunken ", "cheesey ", "mother's ", "father's ", "nan's ", "hair-dresser's ", "manager's ", "wife's ", "husband's ", "children's ", "sister's "); @part6 = ("vagina.", "penis.", "pet dog.", "hamster.", "doctor.", "mother.", "father.", "arsehole.", "belly button.", "scrotum.", "stink-hole."); print($part1[rand(scalar(@part1))] . $part2[rand(scalar(@part2))] . $part3[rand(scalar(@part3))] . $part4[rand(scalar(@part4))] . $part5[rand(scalar(@part5))] . $part6[rand(scalar(@part6))]);

Or how about 8 lines of Perl?

Read full topic

item.title: Mendorphin's Random Sentence Generator Version 1.2 [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

How about 8 lines of code in Ruby?

[code=ruby]Count = 4;
part_1 = ['That person ', 'Jamie ', 'Someone ', 'A moparscaper ']
part_2 = ['wants to ', 'has to ', 'wishes to ', 'needs to ']
part_3 = ['kill ', 'slay ', 'slice ', 'punch ']
part_4 = ['his ', 'her ']
part_5 = [‘mother’, ‘father’, ‘brother’, ‘sister’]

puts part_1[rand(Count)] + part_2 [rand(Count)] + part_3[rand(Count)] + part_4[rand(2)] + part_5[rand(Count)][/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Mendorphin's Random Sentence Generator Version 1.2 [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“Liquid Magic, post:27, topic:369411”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=465541.msg3409652#msg3409652 date=1290571909]
Now write a real program.
[/quote]

Because it’s obviously fake?[/quote]

Frell:

Have it go to a dictionary website to randomly choose adj, verbs, etc.

Hmm yes, but then how can I be sure the sentence will make sense. I had to adapt some elements to have an extra word or two. Take the following:

[Mendorphins] - [can’t wait] - [learn Java.]

[Mendorphins] - can’t wait to] - [learn Java.]

You see it might not work.

Read full topic

item.title: Mendorphin's Random Sentence Generator Version 1.2 [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

LOL thanks.

I updated a little bit:

Updates from Version 1.1

-Deleted the thank you message upon exit
-Added a loop, so you don’t have to keep running the batch file
-Added more words and phrases (+ 0.88KB)
-Packaged

In version 2.0, I want to completely re-write it using extended classes and implements, calling each string individually and displaying all elements for the string called into a GUI.

Remember, this isn’t “how can I develop my sentence generator”, it’s for me to try out new things and share them with you when they work.

Read full topic

item.title: Mendorphin's Random Sentence Generator Version 1.2 [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

John459:

How the fuck did this take an hour?

Because I made a few mistakes and had to fix the errors (missed a couple of comma’s and gave me 22 errors). Also, had to check every sentence made sense.

Crown2:

very good dude

Thanks.

Uncalled:

What’s the point? I mean how bored where you to go and do this? Haha

No point, as I sad it was just for fun.

[quote=“John459, post:11, topic:369411”][quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=465541.msg3404629#msg3404629 date=1290224902]
way better src

[code]/*

  • Men.class

  • Version 1.1

  • 17th November 2010

  • Author: Mendorphins
    */

    import java.util.Random;

    public class Men {

     public static void main (String[] args) {

    /*
    *First string 1
    /
    String[] fs1 = { "Mendorphins " }
    /
    *Second string 2
    /
    String[] ss2 = { "wants to " }
    /
    *Third string 3
    /
    String[] ts3 = { "rape ", "have sex with " }
    /
    *Fourth string 4
    */
    String[] fs4 = { "a " };

    /*
    *Fifth string 5
    */
    String[] fs5 = { "sexy " };

    /*
    *Sixth String 6
    */
    String[] ss6 = { “penis.” };

    /*
    *Random generator, segments 1 - 6
    */
    int ra1 = new Random().nextInt(fs1.length);
    int ra2 = new Random().nextInt(ss2.length);
    int ra3 = new Random().nextInt(ts3.length);
    int ra4 = new Random().nextInt(fs4.length);
    int ra5 = new Random().nextInt(fs5.length);
    int ra6 = new Random().nextInt(ss6.length);

    /*
    *Final output
    */
    System.out.println("\n\t" + fs1[ra1] + ss2[ra2] + ts3[ra3] + fs4[ra4] + fs5[ra5] + ss6[ra6] + “\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n”);

    }
    }[/code]
    [/quote]

It cannot be improved, don’t give it a try.

This is bullshit.[/quote]
It may be bullshit to you but you don’t have to completely put me down about. So what if you can create something 100 times better, this is the first thing I’ve ever done - I gotta start simple, and it made me feel good that I finally got something to work.

I own a few eBooks and a couple of programming text books, so I am reading and learning every day. At least I did something a bit better than ‘Hello World’.

Read full topic
